message=FALSE, warning=FALSE} knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE, fig.path='../assets/images/') ``` # Documentation log count Last update: ```{r, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE} print(Sys.Date()) ``` This doc was built with: `rmarkdown::render("documentation_log.Rmd", output_file = "../pages/documentation_log.md")` Below is the latest count of documentation pages. This figure is updated sporadically to track the current page count and estimated growth rate. This count only considers the main sources in `./pages` but ignores other code pages, images, etc. ```{r word-count, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE} library(purrr) library(lubridate) library(ggplot2) library(dplyr) library(broom) library(patchwork) # Set the path to the directory containing the Markdown files directory_path <- "../pages/" # List all Markdown files in the directory md_files <- list.files(path = directory_path, pattern = "\\.md$", full.names = TRUE) # Define a function to count lines and words in a file count_lines_words <- function(file_path) { lines <- readLines(file_path) word_count <- sum(sapply(lines, function(line) length(strsplit(line, "\\s+")[[1]]))) line_count <- length(lines) data.frame(FileName = basename(file_path), LineCount = line_count, WordCount = word_count) } # Apply the function to each Markdown file and bind the results into a single data frame results <- map_df(md_files, count_lines_words) # sum(results$LineCount) # sum(results$WordCount) ``` ```{r file_count_plot, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE} # Load the data from the log file df <- read.table(file = "./file_counts/file_count_log.md", header = FALSE, col.names = c("Date", "FileCount")) # Convert the date from 'YYYYMMDD' to a Date object df$Date <- ymd(df$Date) # Convert Date to numeric for regression df$DateNumeric <- as.numeric(df$Date) # Linear regression to estimate growth rate fit <- lm(FileCount ~ DateNumeric, data = df) # summary(fit) # Show summary of regression # Extracting the estimated growth rate per day growth_rate <- coef(fit)["DateNumeric"] # Slope coefficient annual_growth_rate <- growth_rate * 365 # Convert daily rate to annual rate # Plotting the data with the regression line p1 <- df %>% ggplot(aes(x = Date, y = FileCount)) + geom_point() + # Plot points geom_line() + # Connect points with line geom_smooth(method="lm", color="grey", alpha=0.2) + # Regression line theme_bw() + # Use a minimalistic theme labs(title = "Number of documentation pages over time", x = "Date", y = "Number of independent pages", subtitle = paste0("Estimated annual growth rate: ", round(annual_growth_rate, 2), "pages/year", "\nCurrent page count: ", max(df$FileCount), "\nTotal line count: ", sum(results$LineCount), "\nTotal word count: ", sum(results$WordCount) )) # Add labels and subtitle # Display the plot print(p1) # Display regression summary as part of the document output cat("Regression Summary:\n") print(summary(fit)) # Print the estimated annual growth rate cat("Estimated Annual Growth Rate (pages/year):", round(annual_growth_rate, 2)) cat("Current count:", max(df$FileCount)) ``` ```{r word-count-plots, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE} # Plotting Line Count Histogram p1 <- ggplot(results, aes(x = LineCount)) + geom_histogram( color = "black") + labs(title = "Histogram of line counts", x = "Line lount", y = "Frequency") + theme_minimal() # Plotting Word Count Histogram p2 <- ggplot(results, aes(x = WordCount)) + geom_histogram(color = "black") + labs(title = "Histogram of word counts", x = "Word count", y = "Frequency") + theme_minimal() # Print the plots print(p1 + p2) ``` ## Change log See `generate_gitlog.sh` for usage. * [View Git Log 2025](../gitlog_2025.txt) * [View Git Log 2024](../gitlog_2024.txt) * [View Git Log 2023](../gitlog_2023.txt) (current year log may not be up-to-date) ```{r echo=FALSE, results='asis'} cat("## 2025", sep="\n") gitlog_path <- "../gitlog_2025.txt" # Adjust the path as needed # Check if the file exists if (file.exists(gitlog_path)) { # Read and print the contents of the git log log_contents <- readLines(gitlog_path) cat(log_contents, sep="\n\n") } else { cat("The git log file for 2025 is not available.") } ``` ```{r echo=FALSE, results='asis'} cat("## 2024", sep="\n") gitlog_path <- "../gitlog_2024.txt" log_contents <- readLines(gitlog_path) cat(log_contents, sep="\n\n") ``` ```{r echo=FALSE, results='asis'} cat("## 2023", sep="\n") gitlog_path <- "../gitlog_2023.txt" log_contents <- readLines(gitlog_path) cat(log_contents, sep="\n\n") ```<hr><footer><div class="d-flex mt-2"></div></footer></div></div><div class="search-overlay"></div></div>
